meanings.definition: To come together to form one mass or whole.
meanings.sent1: The ingredients coalesced to create a delicious soup.
meanings.sent2: The clouds coalesced into a storm overhead.
meanings.sent3: The puzzle pieces coalesced magically into a complete picture.
meanings.sent4: The students' ideas coalesced into a brilliant project.
meanings.sent5: The colors coalesced in the sunset, painting the sky with beauty.

meanings.definition: To unite or merge into a single body or group.
meanings.sent1: The two companies coalesced to form a stronger corporation.
meanings.sent2: The dancers coalesced into a graceful ensemble on stage.
meanings.sent3: The flavors in the dish coalesced to throw a party in my mouth.
meanings.sent4: The voices of the choir coalesced into a harmonious melody.
meanings.sent5: The rivers coalesced at the delta, blending their waters seamlessly.
